intro: Heterochlamys quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of tropical and subtropical areas, particularly in Southeast Asia and northern Australia. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves with five distinct veins, which give it its scientific name. It thrives in saline and brackish water environments, often forming dense mangrove forests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
